English:
What can be said about Digimon? Nothing!
They're both here and not here, right?
Chinese:
那些孩子的事很難說。
要說它們在的話就是在，要說不在的話就是不在，大概是這樣吧？
Korean:
그 아이들에 관해서는, 뭐라 말할 게 없어요
있다고 하면 있고, 없다고 하면 없다― 같은?
German:
Was kann ich über sie sagen? Nichts!
Sie sind hier und doch gleichzeitig nicht hier,
stimmt's?

Chinese:
雖然數碼寶貝捕捉器
已經不存在了。（尚未存在？）

English:
There's an app that's really popular on Digivices
now called "Digital Monster"...
Chinese:
現在Digivice
超流行一個叫「數碼寶貝」的App……
Korean:
지금, 디지바이스에서 엄청 인기있는 앱 중에
「디지털 몬스터」라는 게 있어서…
German:
Es gibt eine ganz beliebte App für Digivices,
die sich „digitale Monster“ nennt ...

English:
It's a sorta retro training game, but I'm actually
finding myself getting super into it.
Chinese:
是個有點復古的養成遊戲，
但就是會讓人相當著迷——
Korean:
좀 복고적인 육성 게임인데
이게 꽤 빠져드는 느낌이라―
German:
Eine Art Retro-Spiel, in dem man Monster
trainiert. Mir gefällt es immer besser.

English:
Agumon and Gabumon are in the app, among others.
So it's, like, surprising, or something.
Chinese:
因為亞古獸和加布獸在那個App裡出現了，
該說是驚訝還是緊壓，該怎麼說呢——
Korean:
그 앱에, 아구몬이나 파피몬이 등장하니까
놀랍다고 할까 반갑다고 할까, 뭐라고 할까―
German:
Agumon und Gabumon sind auch in der App, unter
anderem. Das war eine Überraschung.

English:
Like, totally. I give up.
My brain is totally broken.
Chinese:
就是這樣……我已經投降了。
就是大家常說的，腦袋要爆炸了。
Korean:
같은 느낌으로… 이제, 두 손 다 들었어요
이른바, 머리가 펑이에요
German:
Überhaupt ganz und gar nichts.
Mein Gehirn ist im Eimer.

English: You might be able to figure it out.
